Package model.algorithm

Class DepthFirstSearchTraverseAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.algorithm.DepthFirstSearchTraverseAlgorithm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MazeTraverseAlgorithm, MazeDrawable
    public class DepthFirstSearchTraverseAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object
implements MazeTraverseAlgorithm
    Depth First Search (DFS) algorithm. The algorithm tracks recursively the whole path to the exit. The algorithm does not know the maze structure: i.e the aural location of the Traveller or the size of the maze but it can ask fair question to MazeMap can it be travelled to the left or is there a wall. see: http://www.astrolog.org/labyrnth/algrithm.htm#solve https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W9F8fDQj7Ok https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maze-solving_algorithm

      • registerListener

        public void registerListener​(TraverseAlgorithmProceededListener traverseAlgorithmProceededListener)
        Description copied from interface: MazeTraverseAlgorithm
        Those classes that wish to know when traverse algorithm proceeds (for example UI for live display) should implement the TraverseAlgorithmProceededListener interface and register here as a listener. This function together with the TraverseAlgorithmProceededListener interface provides the Observer Pattern.
        Specified by:
        registerListener in interface MazeTraverseAlgorithm
        Parameters:
        traverseAlgorithmProceededListener - a litterer for every traverse step that the algorithm takes.

      • getMarkers

        public java.util.List<Marker> getMarkers()
        Description copied from interface: MazeDrawable
        A getter method for Markers that can be visualized, what ever they happen to be. Usually for printing staff for users. For example if the algorithm want to show the path one of travel.
        Specified by:
        getMarkers in interface MazeDrawable
        Returns:
        a list of Markers that can be visualized.
